title: Do people feel supported to manage their long-term condition(s)?
analysis_commentary:
When asked in the 2012/2013 GP patient survey 'In the last 6 months, have you had enough support from local services or organisations (not just health services) to help you to manage your long-term health condition(s)?' the majority of patients responded positively: 40% said yes definitely and 24% yes to some extent, and this pattern seems to be continuing into early 2014. Overall, this proportion has increased from 2009/2010 when 56% responded positively compared to 64% in 2014.
The trend is in the right direction, but it is worth noting that there were still more than 1 in 10 patients (12%) stating that they didn't feel supported by any organisation to manage their long-term condition(s) in the last 6 months.
